children.value: is a standard interface for interactions with methods and events described in
. These interactions are generally concerned token locking, such as locking and unlocking tokens.
Get the total number of locked tokens.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total number of locked tokens in the colony.
Get the total number of locked tokens for a given user.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total number of locked tokens.
Deposit tokens. This function only be called if the tokens that the user is attempting to deposit are not locked and if the user has allowed the token locking contract to transfer the tokens.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The amount of tokens that will be deposited.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The address of the token contract receiving the deposit.
The address of the user that deposited tokens.
The amount of tokens that were deposited.
The timestamp when the tokens were deposited.
Lock all tokens for a given token contract.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The address of the token contract that was locked.
The address of the token contract that was assigned.
Increment the token lock counter. This method allows users to waive reward payouts for past reward payout cycles, unlocking the tokens that were locked in previous reward payout cycles.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The ID of the lock count that will be set.
Unlock all tokens for a user on a given token contract.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The ID of the lock count that will be set.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The address of the token contract that was unlocked.
The address of the user that the tokens were unlocked for.
The ID of the lock that the was set for the user.
Withdraw tokens. This function only be called if the tokens that the user is attempting to withdraw are not locked.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The amount of tokens that will be deposited.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The address of the token contract from which tokens were withdrawn.
The address of the user that withdrew tokens.
The amount of tokens that were withdrawn.
// perform an action using the event data
The address of the token contract that was locked.
The address of the token contract that was assigned.

The amount of tokens that were deposited.
The timestamp when the tokens were deposited.
// perform an action using the event data
The address of the token contract that was unlocked.
The address of the user that the tokens were unlocked for.
The ID of the lock that the was set for the user.
// perform an action using the event data
The address of the token contract from which tokens were withdrawn.
The address of the user that withdrew tokens.
The amount of tokens that were withdrawn.
